docs.snippet: Though candidates usually take more moderate positions in the general election, Mr. Trump continues to alienate certain groups, leaving him stagnant in the polls....
docs.lead_paragraph: Though candidates usually take more moderate positions in the general election, Mr. Trump continues to alienate certain groups, leaving him stagnant in the polls.
docs.abstract: Donald J Trump has been unable to crack 45 percent of vote against Hillary Rodham Clinton in several swing states, sign suggesting that he has hit ceiling of voter support; Trump’s advisers express confidence in their strategy and question whether public polls are fully accurate.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Missteps Risk Putting a Ceiling Over His Support in Swing States
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Remarks Cut Into Support in Swing States

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Erie, Pa. Giovanni Russonello contributed research.

docs.snippet: U.S. Republican Donald Trump on Saturday repeated his attack on President Barack Obama that he helped "found" Islamic State and railed against media reports that his campaign is failing, at a campaign rally in Connecticut, a state where he has a l...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Republican Donald Trump on Saturday repeated his attack on President Barack Obama that he helped "found" Islamic State and railed against media reports that his campaign is failing, at a campaign rally in Connecticut, a state where he has a long-shot of being victorious.

headline.main: Trump Rails Against Press in Response to Reports of Chaos
headline.print_headline: Trump Rails Against Press in Response to Reports of Chaos

docs.snippet: Representative Mike Coffman of Colorado, seen as one of the most vulnerable Republican incumbents this year, started learning Spanish after redistricting changed the demographics of his voting pool....
docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Mike Coffman of Colorado, seen as one of the most vulnerable Republican incumbents this year, started learning Spanish after redistricting changed the demographics of his voting pool.
docs.abstract: Republican Rep Mike Coffman faces difficult re-election race in Colorado, where 2013 redistricting has given him new, largely Hispanic constituency; is reaching out to immigrant communities and has explicitly distanced himself from his party's presidential nominee Donald Trump.

headline.main: A Congressman Slighted Immigrants, Then Embraced Them. Now He Runs From Trump.
headline.print_headline: Seen as Vulnerable, a Transformed G.O.P. Incumbent Runs From Trump
